material.mattext: Note that the p-value corresponding to 25 marijuana users is .005. Interpret this value in context.

Recall that in general the p-value tells us how likely it is to get data as extreme as the one observed (or even more extreme) had the null hypothesis been true. In this case...If the p, the proportion of marijuana users in the college were really .157, it would pretty unlikely/surprising (probability of only .005) to find 25 marijuana users or more in a random sample of size 100.
